variants.HGVS: N.D. (Standardization via API is not possible without proper nucleotide/amino - acid change information in the given format)
N.D. (Standardization via API is not possible without proper nucleotide/amino - acid change information in the given format)
N.D. (Standardization via API is not possible without proper nucleotide/amino - acid change information in the given format)

Material used.Description: Purified WT and mutant ␣-synuclein (1 mg/ml) were each incubated at 37 °C, with shaking at 200 rpm in 30 mM Tris - HCl, pH 7.5, containing 0.1% NaN3.

Readout description.Result Description: The A30P mutant fibrillized much slower than WT ␣-synuclein. But A30P seeds accelerated the nucleation - dependent fibrillization of WT ␣-synuclein more effectively than did WT seeds.
The E46K mutant fibrillized faster than WT ␣-synuclein.
The A53T mutant fibrillized faster than WT ␣-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: The results are expressed as means ± S.E. of three independent experiments (n = 3).

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t test was used for statistical analysis. The results are expressed as means ± S.E.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal fibrillization rate can be considered as the rate of WT ␣-synuclein fibrillization under standard conditions)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal fibrillization rate can be considered as a rate significantly different from that of WT ␣-synuclein fibrillization under standard conditions)

Material used.Material Name: Fibrils, seeds and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds
Material used.Description: Fibrils, seeds and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds were diluted in 30 mM Tris - HCl, pH 7.5. Aliquots of these dilutions and centrifugal supernatants of seeds and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds were placed on 400 - mesh collodion - coated grids, negatively stained with 2% lithium phosphotungstate, and observed with a JEOL 1200EXII electron microscope.

Readout description.Conclusion: A30P fibrils had more tiny or short fibrils, higher shedding propensity
Readout description.Result Description: Many tiny or short fibrils were observed in A30P seeds. A30P fibrils had a higher propensity for shedding fragments than WT fibrils.
Relatively long fibrils were predominantly detected in E46K seeds.
Relatively long fibrils were predominantly detected in A53T seeds.

Biological replicates.Description: A typical experiment is shown; similar results were obtained in three separate experiments.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal fibril morphology can be considered as the morphology of WT ␣-synuclein fibrils under standard conditions)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal fibril morphology can be considered as a morphology significantly different from that of WT ␣-synuclein fibrils under standard conditions)

Material used.Material Name: Seeds or fibrils formed in the presence of seeds
Material used.Description: Seeds or fibrils formed in the presence of seeds (1.0 mg/ml) were suspended in 5 volumes of 30 mM Tris - HCl, pH 7.5, and incubated for 30 min at room temperature, followed by ultracentrifugation for 20 min at 109,000 × g. The pellets were resuspended in equal volumes of the supernatant with 30 mM Tris - HCl, pH 7.5.

Readout description.Result Description: More ␣-synuclein was detected in the supernatant of A30P seeds than in those of WT, E46K, and A53T seeds, indicating higher shedding of A30P fibrils.

Readout description.Conclusion: Less ␣-synuclein in supernatant compared to A30P
Readout description.Result Description: Less ␣-synuclein was detected in the supernatant of E46K seeds compared to A30P seeds.

Readout description.Conclusion: Less ␣-synuclein in supernatant compared to A30P
Readout description.Result Description: Less ␣-synuclein was detected in the supernatant of A53T seeds compared to A30P seeds.

Biological replicates.Description: The results are expressed as means ± S.E. (n = 3)

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t test was used for statistical analysis. The results are expressed as means ± S.E.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal amount of ␣-synuclein in supernatant can be considered as the amount in WT ␣-synuclein supernatant under standard conditions)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal amount of ␣-synuclein in supernatant can be considered as an amount significantly different from that of WT ␣-synuclein supernatant under standard conditions)

Material used.Material Name: ␣-Synuclein monomer, seeds and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds
Material used.Description: ␣-Synuclein monomer, seeds and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds were diluted in 30 mM Tris - HCl, pH 7.5, 0.1% NaN3 and spotted onto polyvinylidene difluoride membrane.

Readout description.Result Description: Dot blot analysis showed that A30P fibrils had a distinct conformation from WT fibrils. A30P fibrils were labeled strongly with syn1 - 10 but hardly at all with syn75 - 91.
WT fibrils were recognized very strongly by antibodies to the N - terminal region and NAC region, different from A30P fibrils.

Biological replicates.Description: A typical experiment is shown; similar results were obtained in three separate experiments.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, normal immunoreactivity pattern can be considered as the pattern of WT ␣-synuclein fibrils under standard conditions)

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: N.D. (Based on general knowledge, abnormal immunoreactivity pattern can be considered as a pattern significantly different from that of WT ␣-synuclein fibrils under standard conditions)

Material used.Material Name: Seeds or fibrils formed in the presence of seeds
Material used.Description: Seeds or fibrils formed in the presence of seeds (1.0 mg/ml) were sonicated and treated with 50 g/ml trypsin or 2 g/ml proteinase K at 37 °C for 30 min. The reaction was stopped by boiling for 5 min. The solution was treated with sample buffer containing 2% SDS and 8 M urea and subjected to SDS - PAGE.

Readout description.Conclusion: Distinct core structure from WT fibrils
Readout description.Result Description: A30P fibrils had distinct protease - resistant core bands compared to WT fibrils. Trypsin digestion of A30P fibrils showed two major bands of 9.5 and ϳ12.5 kDa, different from WT fibrils.

Readout description.Conclusion: Distinct core structure from A30P fibrils
Readout description.Result Description: WT fibrils had distinct protease - resistant core bands compared to A30P fibrils. Trypsin digestion of WT fibrils showed two major bands of 10 and ϳ13 kDa.

Biological replicates.Description: A typical experiment is shown; similar results were obtained in three separate experiments.
